node.title: Third extension for Katherine mask mandate amid concern about low testing numbers
node.alt: A car drives past the Katherine sign on the outskirts of the township.
node.description: A mask mandate in Katherine has been extended for another two days as authorities remain concerned about low COVID-19 testing rates and positive wastewater results in the town, followingÂ last week's COVID cluster.
node.content:
["A mask mandate in Katherine has been extended for another 48 hours, with health authorities still concerned about low testing rates after COVID-19 viral fragments were detected in wastewater samples last week.", "The mask rules, which came into effect last Monday, were initially scheduled to end at 5pm today, but will now remain in place until 5pm on Wednesday.", "It is the third time the mask mandate has been extended following a COVID outbreak in Katherine and Greater Darwin about a week ago.", "Northern Territory Chief Minister Michael Gunner said while results for the latest round of wastewater samples were still pending, too few people were getting tested for COVID for authorities to be confident the town was in the clear.", "\"On Saturday we only had 26 people tested, [and] that's why we're extending the mask mandate,\" he said.", "COVID-19 viral fragments were discovered in Katherine wastewater samples last Wednesday, prompting Health Minister Natasha Fyles to ask residents to closely monitor their health for symptoms.", "Authorities also re-tested all 12 local close contacts of the cluster's index case.", "On Friday, the NT government said traces of COVID had been detected at the Katherine Golf Club and the Bicentennial Road catchments on November 10 and 11, and extended the mask mandate in the town for 24 hours.", "The mandate was extended for a second time \u2014\u00a0this time for 48 hours \u2014\u00a0on Saturday.\u00a0", "Wastewater testing results for Saturday and Sunday are expected to come back later today.", "Mr Gunner said health authorities were \"alert, but not alarmed\" about the results, but needed Katherine residents to assist them by getting tested if they showed any symptoms.", "\"There's nothing more to this than a few wastewater results that we're worried about,\" he said.", "\"But we want to get a significant number of tests done in Katherine, so we can just remove that doubt and move on.\"", "The mask mandate in Katherine requires people to wear a mask when they are unable to maintain a 1.5-metre distance from others, including in shopping centres and on public transport.", "It also requires masks to be worn at restaurants, cafes and pubs except for during eating or drinking.", "Masks are not required while doing exercise or playing sport.", "A mask mandate that was in place in Greater Darwin following last week's cluster has now been lifted.", "", "
WA's COVID-19 reopening roadmap
"]
